channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Emma Partridge
item.description: Following more than two decades of work by Mudgee detectives and later the unsolved homicide squad, a former neighbour of the girl has been charged with murdering her.
item.title: Michelle Bright's alleged killer made Facebook post after police appeal into her death

item.dc:creator: Jake Niall
item.description: The AFL is considering a system in which the higher-ranked team could state a preference for playing at a particular stadium, from limited options.
item.title: Choose your 'home' field – the AFL's potential finals plan

item.dc:creator: Michael Fowler
item.description: Jobs Minister Martin Pakula used his appearance before a parliamentary committee to distance himself from the lapses in hotel quarantine.
item.title: 'Responsible for logistics': Minister says health department in charge of hotel quarantine infection control

item.dc:creator: Daniel Cherny
item.description: Having missed Melbourne's first ever AFLW final because of the coronavirus, Irishwomen Sinead Goldrick and Niamh McEvoy have both recommitted to the Demons' for the 2021 national women's league campaign.
item.title: Dees must wait on Perkins, but Irishwomen coming back

item.dc:creator: Andrew Wu
item.description: The Swans and Giants have lost key players for their clash in Perth.
item.title: Key defenders Davis and Aliir out of Sydney derby

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: A push by two Virgin Australia bondholders to disrupt the bankrupt airline’s sale to Bain Capital has gained the support of investment giants.
item.title: Virgin's rebel bondholders get UBS, Credit Suisse, Deutsche support

item.dc:creator: Nick Bonyhady
item.description: National Australia Bank is axing hundreds of positions as it remodels itself while coping with the financial fallout from COVID-19.
item.title: NAB staff in firing line as bank pushes ahead with restructure amid pandemic

item.dc:creator: Michael Chammas
item.description: The NRL could lose one of its biggest stars if the COVID-19 crisis forces the Warriors to be parted from their families again next year.
item.title: Tuivasa-Sheck to consider shock rugby switch

item.dc:creator: Sam McClure
item.description: Though there has been no official correspondence, the Brisbane Lions are interested in rarely sighted Essendon forward Joe Daniher.
item.title: Lions interested in Bombers forward Daniher

item.description: Everything you need to know to pick a winner on an eight-race card.
item.title: Race-by-race tips and preview for Newcastle on Thursday

item.description: The Paul Perry-trained gelding has drawn nearer the outside in all three starts, but is on the extreme inside on Thursday.
item.title: Inside job: Sky Lab ready to show he has no barrier to success

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: Labor caucus members have dismissed a call from resources spokesman Joel Fitzgibbon to back new gas pipelines with taxpayer support.
item.title: Labor anger over Joel Fitzgibbon's support for gas subsidies

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: After being one of the stories of last season's trade period, contracted Bomber Orazio Fantasia is not attracting much interest in his hometown at the moment.
item.title: South Australian clubs slow on Orazio Fantasia

item.dc:creator: Adam Pengilly
item.description: The 35-year-old has only a couple of biosecurity protocols to complete before he's allowed to join his Roosters teammates this weekend.
item.title: After two weeks in quarantine, Sonny Bill about to be set free

item.dc:creator: Sam Phillips
item.description: The Roosters' cautious approach to concussions will sideline their captain for another fortnight.
item.title: 'We don’t want it to be ongoing': Why Robinson, Roosters won't rush Cordner

item.dc:creator: Matt Bungard
item.description: NSW Liquor and Gaming is warning there will be no more second chances for venues when it comes to adhering to social distancing regulations and the next step is temporary closures.
item.title: Venues could face closures if COVID-19 breaches continue

item.dc:creator: Mike Foley
item.description: CSIRO is changing the way it works in an attempt to deliver breakthroughs of the same scale as its Wi-Fi technology to help the nation recover from COVID-19.
item.title: 'History will judge us': CSIRO to invest in collaborations to solve 'real world problems'

item.dc:creator: Linda Morris
item.description: The plan would see Parramatta's Willow Grove dismantled and then rebuilt in a new location.
item.title: Infrastructure NSW flags relocating historic building for Powerhouse

item.description: The best photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors
item.title: Gallery: The best photos from around the world

item.dc:creator: Chris Roots
item.description: Victorian contenders for The Everest will be shunned by slot holders until Racing NSW allows horses to cross the border.
item.title: Victorian Everest contenders plead for border to reopen

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: Queensland doctors have condemned a new trial to allow pharmacies across the state to test for COVID-19.
item.title: Doctors say pharmacy COVID-19 testing trial could be 'disastrous'

item.dc:creator: Vince Rugari
item.description: NSW Deputy Premier John Barilaro insists ANZ Stadium is still a chance after meeting with AFL executives this week.
item.title: Sydney 'still in the running' for AFL grand final: NSW Deputy Premier

item.description: Looky Looky Here Comes Cooky examines the Indigenous view of Captain James Cook's legacy.
item.title: What's on TV: Thursday, August 20

item.dc:creator: Tom Rabe
item.description: The coronavirus’ impact on supplies and access to overseas workers could affect the planned opening of Sydney’s multibillion-dollar NorthConnex motorway.
item.title: Coronavirus 'challenges' affect Sydney NorthConnex tunnel opening

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: A Brisbane convenience store worker who raped a teenager after she asked to use the bathroom has lost his appeal.
item.title: Valley store worker who raped teenager in bathroom claimed it was consensual

item.description: What transpires on Nine's Emergency is at once familiar to the genre but riveting as it unfolds.
item.title: What's on TV: Wednesday, August 19

item.dc:creator: Georgina Mitchell
item.description: Mick Hawi, former national president of the Comancheros, was gunned down outside Fitness First gym in Rockdale in 2018.
item.title: Witnesses saw black-clad man fleeing after Hawi shooting, jury told

item.description: Surface testing is under way in an Auckland cool store where a man from an infected family-of-four worked. It is believed a further four people who had contact with the family are now infected.
item.title: Concerns mount virus returned to New Zealand in refrigerated freight

item.dc:creator: Clancy Yeates
item.description: Commonwealth Bank CEO says it's reasonable to assume house prices could tumble as much as 12 per cent despite the market proving more resilient than expected in recent months.
item.title: CBA still expecting house prices to drop at least 10%

item.dc:creator: Daniel Cherny
item.description: St Kilda's hopes of a first finals appearance in nine years have been dealt a major blow with star midfielder Jade Gresham a chance to miss the rest of the season with a back stress fracture.
item.title: Gresham's season in doubt with back injury

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: Melbourne's return to a hard lockdown has thrown back toll road giant Transurban's COVID-19 recovery, but the company says predictions the pandemic will bring on a lasting shift to people working at home are overblown.
item.title: Transurban says COVID has hit traffic, but commuters will return to the office

item.description: Thousands of new flag designs were submitted to replace the American state's recently retired Confederate flag. One was not meant to be shortlisted.
item.title: 'Zapped': Agency swats down prospect of mosquito flag for Mississippi

item.dc:creator: Samantha Selinger-Morris
item.description: What do we know about Ghislaine Maxwell? What legal proceedings relate to her? And what are the next steps in this story?
item.title: Who is Ghislaine Maxwell and what is she charged with?

item.description: ABC's The Great Acceleration examines a different field of technological research each week.
item.title: What's on TV: Tuesday, August 18

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: The Warriors aren't likely to be turned off a pursuit of the troubled superstar forward as St George Illawarra chase one of their local juniors.
item.title: Warriors target Pangai jnr, Dragons want Bird to make flight home

item.description: As The Farmer Wants a Wife progesses, the confrontations are starting to look very familiar.
item.title: What's on TV: Monday, August 17

item.dc:creator: Bevan Shields
item.description: The Australian head of the world's largest business organisation says appetite among world leaders to solve problems together has "all but evaporated".
item.title: 'Onshoring' manufacturing after pandemic will drive up prices: ICC boss John Denton

item.dc:creator: Sam Phillips
item.description: Alex Johnston has arguably been the Rabbitohs' best player this year but there is no room for him at Redfern beyond this season.
item.title: 'It’s heartbreaking': Johnston resigned to leaving Souths as rival clubs circle

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: Deputy Commissioner Steve Gollschewski said the escapee was a Toowoomba local who allegedly tried to cross the border unlawfully.
item.title: Queensland quarantine escapee returns to hotel, sparks police review

item.dc:creator: Marissa Calligeros
item.description: Victoria has recorded 21 deaths, a new high in the state's daily death toll, and 410 new cases, while NSW health authorities focus on a religious retreat that may have sparked a Sydney school cluster.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: 21 more deaths, 410 new cases in Victoria; Premier warns of harsher rules for NSW; Auckland back in lockdown

item.dc:creator: Ben Pobjie
item.description: Survey says, what the world needs right now is 'Family Feud' celebrating our frontline workers.
item.title: Grant Denyer will take silly over serious any day

item.dc:creator: Craig Mathieson
item.description: Best known for This Is England and Line of Duty, the acclaimed actress dons horn-rim glasses to play a stern spy in the action series Alex Rider.
item.title: Vicky McClure wants to make TV that reflects her working-class origins

item.description: Over the years, Sally Wainwright’s finely-cast family yarn has been quietly groundbreaking.
item.title: Last Tango in Halifax is grown-up storytelling to be savoured

item.description: The weird, trippy and troubling themes of pulp fiction writer H.P. Lovecraft found their way into film and TV long before the new Lovecraft Country.
item.title: Gods, monsters and H.P. Lovecraft’s uncanny legacy

item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Knight
item.description: CEO Matt Comyn didn’t need fabulous earnings to be crowned king of the banking sector - his bank just had to do better than the rest.
item.title: CBA streaks away from the pack with capital strong, earnings lite result

item.description: The 2021 Australian Open could be moved to later in the year due to COVID-19 but tournament director Craig Tiley says organisers are confident of hosting the grand slam in its usual January slot with full prizemoney and fans in the stands.
item.title: Five 'bubbles', 400,000 fans and full prizemoney at 2021 Australian Open

item.dc:creator: The Herald's View
item.description: The Democrat vice presidential candidate will play a crucial role in an election where race and gender will be centre stage.
item.title: Kamala Harris can strike a blow for diversity in politics

item.dc:creator: Georgina Robinson
item.description: After a horror 2019, James Ramm is bucking the 2020 trend and enjoying a breakout season.
item.title: How phone call from Wallabies coach helped young Waratah see the light

item.dc:creator: Peter FitzSimons
item.description: No-one, least of all me, wants to go back to the bad old days of #StadiumSplurge wars. But this has to be said.
item.title: Barilaro's 'more Bankwests' talk leaves taxpayers out in the cold

item.dc:creator: Malcolm Knox
item.description: Following a Herald investigation last year that revealed the game had about 264,000 known individual participants, CA’s figures this year acknowledged its online registration system had logged 295,240 unique players.
item.title: CA community investment pays off with rise in player numbers
